product_desc: Champaran Ahuna Handi Mutton Instant Liquid Masala - Ready To Cook Indian Curry Cooking Paste
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Champaran meat, also known as Ahuna handi mutton masala, handi meat masala or batlohi, is a dish with its roots in Champaran, a district of Bihar. A traditional recipe with an abundance of authenticness and masalas in use, Champaran Mutton is generally made in a handi whose mouth is sealed with kneaded flour. Rich in flavours, homely and a delightful yet spicy mutton dish, get ready for a wonderful ride with CERES FOODS. If you are willing to make some traditional Champaran Mutton just in the comfort of your home, CERES FOODS is the one for you. Arriving with its ready-to-use curry mix or instant Masala you can create this masterpiece instantly! Meat or Mutton is marinated in a mix of mustard oil and ghee, garlic, onions, and ginger with the paste of spices.
The mouth of the handi (earthenware pot) is sealed with kneaded flour. It is cooked slowly on a low flame of a wood fire and tossed continuously while cooking. The taste and cooking time depend on the quality of the meat. No more chopping onions and cooking for endless hours and adding multiple spices. Just add meat to our delicious products and achieve results you will be proud of. Ready to cook. Instant liquid masala, Mutton Masala and Meat Masala are Made from the finest ingredients. No preservatives. Locally produced. Hygienically prepared and packed. Easy to make in 3 steps, just add mutton (or Chicken or Fish or Vegetables or Paneer or Prawns) and water to create your very own Champaran Ahuna Handi Mutton The range is inspired by the Regional & Heritage recipes to give you an exquisite style dish right out of your kitchen Each pack contains 200 grams Ready Curry Mix which needs 750gms of Meat or Veggies and it easily serves 4-5 people Made In India | Roots of India.
Ingredients:
Onion (36.46%), Mustard Oil (15.63%), Butter (8.33%), Garlic (5.21%), Ginger Garlic Paste (2.47%), Chilli (1.80%), Spices & Condiments (4.06%), Water (26.04).
Nutritional Facts:
Per 100g:

Calories 720.7 kcal
Total Fat 59.56 g
Sodium 1623.68 mg
Total Carbohydrates 40.72 g
Protein 5.44 g
Calcium 163.68 mg
Potassium 491.36 mg
Iron 4.1 g
Storage and Uses:
Pair it with some rice, parathas or chapati for a wholesome combo.
Just add mutton to our delicious product and achieve results you will be proud of. 
Storage Instructions: Best to be stored in a cool and dry place.

About the Product:
Planning a barbeque party at home? Or are you just in the mood to have a yummy non-veg meal? Sunrise Meat Masala mix has got you covered. This special blend of onion, garlic, coriander, cardamom and clove, enhanced with flavours of mace and nutmeg- can help to prepare some lip-smacking meat recipes.
For meat lovers who are looking for a strong and tasty spice mix, this is a must-have masala. You can prepare some yummy chicken or mutton curry, you could even use this to marinate your meat for frying or grilling. No matter what you do, one thing is guaranteed, everyone is just going to love its taste. Use this magic mix at home and become the 'Badshah of barbeques' or 'the king of your kitchen'.
Treat your family member to some delicious meat with Sunrise Meat Masala. You can use it the way you want but the result will always be yummy. Get your pack of Sunrise Meat Masala mix and start cooking!
Ingredients:
Mix Blended Spices.
Features:
MEAT MASALA – A special mix of spices that can be used to cook many classic meat recipes at home.
 INGREDIENTS – This blend is made of onion, garlic, coriander, cardamom and clove, enhanced with flavours of mace and nutmeg.
 FLAVOUR – Sunrise Pure Meat Masala is made with premium quality spices and gives a strong and spicy taste to your recipes.
 CREATE TEMPTING MEALS – This magic mix can be used to make some authentic curries or to marinate meat for frying or barbeques.
 LEGACY - Since its inception over a century ago, Sunrise has dedicated itself to delivering traditional, authentic taste & quality products that stay true to their origins.
 OUR RANGE - Sunrise offers a range of products that cater to the Bengali palate such as Sunrise Pure Shukto Masala Powder, Sunrise Pure Macher Jhol Masala Powder, Sunrise Pure Panch Phoron Whole Spice, etc.

About the Product:
Jeerakati rice is boiled extra thin basmati rice, It is also known as Wayanadan Kaima, is a popular traditional small aromatic rice. Its use making any rice recipe and the daily use. It is known for its supreme quality and delectable taste. Jeerakathi is an endemic rice variant found in the Indian state of West Bengal.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 347
Carbs: 78g
Fat: 1g
Protein: 9g.
Ingredients:
Tamil Ponni Boiled Rice.
Storage and Uses:
1. Raw rice should typically be prepared with double the quantity of water. 2. One cup of rice should be added to at least two cups of boiling water. 3. Once it is cooked, it should be covered and left to stand before it is drained. 4. Serve this rice along with Dal or curry of your choice.
1. Store in a cool and dry place 2. Keep away from moisture

Storage and Uses:
Simple Steps to make tasty Veg Sabji Heat 3 tablespoon of oil in a kadai and add chopped vegetables and fry them in medium flame for 10-15 mins.
Transfer the vegetables to a bowl and heat 1 tbsp of oil in the same kadai.
Add cumin seeds to crackle. Then add cashew nuts and fry till golden brown.
Add cut onions and fry till it changes to light brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for few more minutes.
Add cut tomatoes and fry till it gets cooked. Transfer this mixture to a separate bowl to cool down.
After the mixture gets cooled, grind it to a smooth paste.
Heat the rest of 1 tablespoon oil in the kadai and add the ground paste.
Add 2 tbsp Sri Sri Tattva Garam Masala and salt to this paste and cook on low flame for few minutes.
Add the fried vegetables to the gravy and ½ cup water for 10 mins.
Add kasuri methi, coriander leaves and fresh cream. Mix them well and let it stay for few seconds and switch off the flame. Yummy mixed veg sabji is ready.
Serve with hot rice/roti. In fact Sri Sri Tattva Garam Masala can be used in a variety of foods. You may use all type of sabji, farsans, dal,etc.

Flavour Drum Black Salt Powder is a unique and essential ingredient for any kitchen that loves to create flavorful and savoury dishes. The powder is packaged to maintain its quality and aroma, ensuring that it stays fresh and potent for longer. About the Product:
Catch Dal Tadka Masala is one of its own kind in the market. This Indian spice adds a tadka and savoury aroma to the arhar dal or mix dal. The blended Indian masalas are measured to perfection and ground at low temperatures. Thus, assuring, the perfect combination of various simple Indian spices.
Ingredients:
Coriander Whole, Iodised Salt, Cumin Whole, Dried Mango Slices, Chillies and Capsicum Whole, Edible Common Salt, Dried Ginger Whole, Long Pepper Whole, Large Cardamom Whole, Pepper Black Whole, Asafoetida, Cassia Whole, Cloves Whole, Nutmeg Whole, Dehydrated Green Coriander Leaves, Fenugreek Leaves, Mace Whole, Citric Acid (INS 330). Spice Content: 74%, Salt Content: 25%.
How to Use:
Dal Tadka Recipe: 

Clean and wash 200 gm Tur Dal (Arhar dal)/Mix Dal. Add 8 cups (1200ml) water, 1⁄2 tsp Catch Turmeric Powder, salt as per taste and pressure cook. After one whistle, keep on low flame for 8-10 minutes.
Heat 2 tbsp desi ghee or oil in a pan or 'kadhai', now add 1 tsp Catch Cumin Seeds and let them crackle.
Add 1⁄2 tsp Catch Hing and cook for a few seconds, now add 1 tsp chopped garlic, 1 tsp chopped ginger and add 1⁄2 tsp green chillis and cook for 2 minutes.
Now add 2 medium size finely chopped onions and cook for 3 minutes after this add 2 medium-sized chopped tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes on medium flame.
Now add 2 tsp 'Dal Tadka Masala' and cook for 2 minutes on low flame then add 100ml water and cook for 2 minutes.
Add boiled dal and mix well. Let it simmer for 3 minutes on a low flame.
Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves and 1 tsp of desi ghee and serve hot with rice/roti.

Storage: 

Keep in a clean, cool and dry place away from sunlight.
Once opened, store the contents in an airtight container.

Storage and Uses:
Simple Steps to make a savoury Sabji Sri Sri Tattva Kitchen King Masala is a versatile powder that can be used in any vegetarian dish.
Simple steps to delicious Kitchen King Masala dishes Paneer Makhani Heat 2 tbsp butter in a kadhai, add 1 tsp garlic paste and saute on a medium flame for a few seconds.
Add 6 cinnamon, 2 cloves, 2 cardamoms, 1 bay leaf and saute on a medium flame for few more seconds.
Add 2 tsp dried fenugreek leaves, 2 tbsp of Sri Sri Tattva Kitchen King Masala, 2 cups of tomato puree and saute on a medium flame for another 2 to 3 minutes while stirring continuously.
Add salt to taste, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes, while stirring continuously.
Add 2 tbsp curds, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 more minute.
Add ½ tbsp sugar, ¼ cup of water, 1 cup paneer (cottage cheese) and 2 tbsp cream, mix well and cook on a medium flame for another 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh cream and serve.

product_desc: Onion Garlic Masala - Blend Of 19 Ingredients, Rich Aroma, Freshness Locked
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Tablespoon Onion Garlic Masala is a perfect blend of 19 carefully selected ingredients to deliver an authentic local taste. Onion Garlic Masala, commonly known as Kanda Lasun masala/ Ghati Masala, can not only be used in vegetable and pulses preparation but also be used like Dry Chutney Powder.  It is crafted in small batches and  packed in ziplock pouches to  retain aroma and freshness till the last tablespoon.
Ingredients:
Onion, Chilli, Salt, Garlic, Coriander, Cumin, Black Cumin, Black Pepper, Cloves, Cinnamon, Bay Leaves,  Poppy Seed, Black Cardamom, Green Cardamom, Fennel Seed, Star Anise, Mace, Nutmeg, Cinnamon Buds
How to Use:
1. Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions and dry coconut and grind to a coarse paste. Take the paste in a bowl and add to it coriander leaves, tamarind extract, jaggery, garlic - green chilli paste, Tablespoon Onion Garlic Masala and salt. Slit the brinjals while keeping the stems intact and stuff the mixture into it. Leave some mixture for gravy.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard & cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Then add the brinjals, remaining mixture & half a cup of water, cover the vessel and cook it over medium flame gently turning the brinjals a few times till the brinjals are cooked soft.
3. Garnish it with coriander leaves and serve with hot Jowari Bhakri/ Roti. Onion Garlic Masala also goes well with pulses, vegetables and meat preparations. It can also be used as dry chutney powder.

About the Product:
Aloo Dum or Alu Dum is a spiced potato dish from the Indian subcontinent, most commonly eaten with flatbread like roti or puri for breakfast. The potatoes are first fried or boiled, and then slowly simmered in a spiced gravy. Different variations exist across the subcontinent, including the addition of yogurt, tomato paste or cashew cream to thicken the sauce. It is especially delicious with baby potatoes! JK Aloo Dum Masala is a pre-made spice mix will help you create lip-smacking aloo dum in absolutely no time! Ideal for frugal cooks on a budget, or those committed to a Vegan or vegetarian diet, this seasoning mix will help you create a flavourful, nutritious and filling batch of aloo dum that will impress everyone you serve it to. Create a potato feast with JK Aloo Dum Masala today!
Ingredients:
Coriander, Chili, Cashew, Cumin, Fenugreek Leaves, Common Salt, Ginger, Garlic, Bayleaf, Asafoetida, Turmeric, Cardamom, Cassia, Clove.

product_desc: Sona Masuri Rice White - Pesticide Free
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Sona Masuri is a lightweight and aromatic medium-grain rice which is the result of a cross combination of the rice varieties Sona and Mahsuri. It is grown largely in the Indian states of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Karnataka. Sona masoori rice come from its carbohydrate content. That same 45-gram serving of dry rice contains 35 grams of carbohydrates. Sona masoori rice does not contain any fiber. Carbohydrates are an essential nutrient and provides most of your caloric intake
Ingredients:
Pesticide Free Sona Masuri Rice

How to Use:
Washing the rice, it is best to rinse it under running water. Put your rice to wash in a bowl and hold it under running water. Rub the rice with your hands gently. Rinse it until the water becomes clear.                                                                                                                                    Use a large pan or cooking container, as rice double or triple in volume during cooking. (Dry rice will yield approximately 2-3 times their original amount when cooked.) Bring water to a boil, cover tightly, reduce heat and simmer until rice is completely cooked.

about_the_product:
About the Product:
Graminway Black Salt is referred to as kala namak, is a variety of Indian volcanic stone salt. It is popular in India and nations all across the world because of its twisted taste and easy availability. This special variety of salt has its origin in the Himalayan ranges and is widely used in North Indian dishes for cooking. Kala namak is used extensively in Bangladesh, Nepal, India and Pakistan as a condiment or is added to chaats, chutney, salads, all kinds of fruits, raita and many other savoury Indian snacks.

How to Use:
Wash (whole / dals) pulses, it is best toÂ rinse them under running water. Put your grains to wash in a bowl and hold it under running water. Rub the grains with your hands gently. Rinse it until the water becomes clear.                                                                                                 Use a large saucepan or cooking container, as pulses double or triple in volume during cooking. (Dry pulses will yield approximately 2-3 times their original amount when cooked.) Bring water to a boil, cover tightly, reduce heat and simmer until pulses are just tender and not mushy.

product_desc: Sugar Control Diabetic Atta - Clinically Tested Low GL Flour
about_the_product:
About the Product:
50% Lower Sugar Spike: The DiabeSmart Atta helps reduce sugar spikes by 50% compared to regular Atta. This makes it an effective option for sugar control since it releases blood glucose slowly into your bloodstream, helping you manage post-meal sugar spikes.
Tested for Diabetics: DiabeSmart is one of the few brands that has been tested and published reports on its effectiveness in managing diabetes and pre-diabetes.
Diabetic-Friendly Ayurvedic Ingredients: The Diabetic Atta is made from 100% natural plant-based ingredients such as Methi seeds, Karela seeds, Jamun Seeds, and Jackfruit flour, known in Ayurveda to help with blood sugar level management. It complements other diabetic products like protein powder, Karela Jamun juice for diabetes, or low glycemic diabetic rice.
No Compromise in Taste & Texture: Our Diabetic Flour strikes the right balance between health and taste. You can make delicious diabetic-friendly Rotis, Parathas, etc., without even realizing that it's specifically made for diabetics.
Ingredients:
Wheat Flour (atta), Coconut Flour, Wheat Bran, Wheat Fibre, Chickpea Flour, Psyllium Husk, Flax Seeds, Quinoa Flour, Oat Flour, Ragi Flour, Jackfruit Flour, Methi Seed Powder (0.2%), Jamun Seed Powder (0.2%), And Karela Seed Powder (0.1%).

about_the_product:

Tablespoon Kashmiri Powder is a must-have on your spice rack for all Indian preparations. Kashmiri Chillies are mildly spicy and deliver a natural bright red colour to food preparations. Chilli

Per 100 g

Energy 434kcal,

Carbohydrates 57.6g,

How to Use:
1. Cut the chicken into medium pieces, marinate them with 1/2 tbsp Tablespoon Chicken Tikka Masala, Tablespoon Kashmiri Chilli Powder, curd and lime. Set aside for 30 min.
2. Take oil in the pan, add onion puree, green chillies & ginger-garlic paste and sauté till onions are cooked. Add tomato puree and remaining Tablespoon Chicken tikka Masala, fry till oil separates and forms a thick paste. Set aside the paste. Take ghee in the pan and fry the marinated chicken piece till partly cooked. Add the masala paste and 1 cup of water. Cover with lid and cook for 10 min.
3. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with hot rotis / batura, chopped onions and lemon.

The cuisines of Bangladesh and Sri Lanka depend heavily on the use of coconut, which means you can make your own homemade sambal or Bengali dried fish curry! About the Product:
Our range of fresh and aromatic whole spices is carefully handpicked by our experts. They are cleaned, powdered and packed at our hygienic facilities. Our Sambhar Masala is a fine blend of different spices which adds that authentic taste to your daily dishes. Enjoy nature’s finest selection of powdered spices.
Ingredients:
Coriander, Chillies, Cumin, Bengal Gram, Tuvar dal, Urad Dal, Black Pepper, Turmeric, Dry Ginger, Fenugreek, Salt, Asafoetida & Curry Leaves.
How to Use:
Sambhar:

Cook 200g of toor dal along with pieces of drumstick, brinjal, pumpkins and onions for 15 minutes.
Add 1 tbsp. of bb ROYAL Sambhar Powder, 2 tbsp. of thick tamarind juice, 1⁄2 tbsp. of chilli powder and salt to taste.
For tempering - heat 2 tbsp. of oil, add 1 red chilli, 14 tbsp. of fenugreek, 1/4 tbsp. of mustard seeds, 1 tbsp. of curry leaves and a pinch of asafoetida and saute it.
Add tempered mixture, to sambhar and let it simmer for 2 minutes. Serve hot with dosas/idlis.
